Label: We use some basic annotation properties.
Existing object properties listed in the Replacement columns will be used in place of more specific COB object properties in this sheet.
part of
Definition: a core relation that holds between a part and its whole

Label: has part
Definition: a core relation that holds between a whole and its part

Label: realizes
Definition: Paraphrase of elucidation: a relation between a process and a realizable entity, where there is some material entity that is bearer of the realizable entity and participates in the process, and the realizable entity comes to be realized in the course of the process

Label: has specified input
Definition: The inverse property of is_specified_input_of

Label: has specified output
Definition: The inverse property of is_specified_output_of

Label: specified output of
Definition: A relation between a planned process and a continuant participating in that process. The presence of the continuant at the end of the process is explicitly specified in the objective specification which the process realizes the concretization of.

Label: characteristic of
Definition: a relation between a specifically dependent continuant (the characteristic) and any other entity (the bearer), in which the characteristic depends on the bearer for its existence.

Label: has characteristic
Definition: Inverse of characteristic_of

Label: participates in
Definition: a relation between a continuant and a process, in which the continuant is somehow involved in the process

Label: has participant
Definition: a relation between a process and a continuant, in which the continuant is somehow involved in the process

Label: is concretized as
Definition: A relationship between a generically dependent continuant and a specifically dependent continuant, in which the generically dependent continuant depends on some independent continuant in virtue of the fact that the specifically dependent continuant also depends on that same independent continuant. A generically dependent continuant may be concretized as multiple specifically dependent continuants.

Label: concretizes
Definition: A relationship between a specifically dependent continuant and a generically dependent continuant, in which the generically dependent continuant depends on some independent continuant in virtue of the fact that the specifically dependent continuant also depends on that same independent continuant. Multiple specifically dependent continuants can concretize the same generically dependent continuant.

Label: derives from
Definition: a relation between two distinct material entities, the new entity and the old entity, in which the new entity begins to exist when the old entity ceases to exist, and the new entity inherits the significant portion of the matter of the old entity

Label: location of
Definition: a relation between two independent continuants, the location and the target, in which the target is entirely within the location

Label: located in
Definition: a relation between two independent continuants, the target and the location, in which the target is entirely within the location

Label: capable of
Definition: A relation between a material entity (such as a cell) and a process, in which the material entity has the ability to carry out the process.

Label: surrounded by
Definition: x surrounded_by y if and only if (1) x is adjacent to y and for every region r that is adjacent to x, r overlaps y (2) the shared boundary between x and y occupies the majority of the outermost boundary of x

Label: surrounds
Definition: inverse of surrounded by

Label: has input
Definition: p has input c iff: p is a process, c is a material entity, c is a participant in p, c is present at the start of p, and the state of c is modified during p.

Label: has output
Definition: p has output c iff c is a participant in p, c is present at the end of p, and c is not present in the same state at the beginning of p.

Label: enabled by
Definition: inverse of enables

Label: Material entities are the core of OBO. They are easy to individuate. We start with naturally occurring material entities.
material entity
Editor Note: Elucidation: An independent continuant that is spatially extended whose identity is independent of that of other entities and can be maintained through time.

Label: subatomic particle
Definition: A particle smaller than an atom.

Label: electron
Definition: Elementary particle not affected by the strong force having a spin 1/2, a negative elementary charge and a rest mass of 0.000548579903(13) u, or 0.51099906(15) MeV.

Label: proton
Definition: Nuclear particle of charge number +1, spin 1/2 and rest mass of 1.007276470(12) u.

Label: neutron
Definition: Nuclear particle of zero charge, spin 1/2 and rest mass of 1.008664904(14) u.

Label: atomic nucleus
Definition: A nucleus is the positively charged central portion of an atom, excluding the orbital electrons.
Editor Note: This is equivalent to CHEBI:33252|Some people may be uncomfortable calling every proton an atomic nucleus

Label: atom
Definition: A material entity consisting of exactly one atomic nucleus and the electron(s) orbiting it.
Editor Note: This atom is closely related to ChEBI's atom, but not exactly equivalent to.

Label: molecule
Definition: A material entity that consists of two or more atoms that are all connected via covalent bonds such that any atom can be transitively connected with any other atom.
Editor Note: We would like to have cardinality restrictions on the logic, but there are some technical limitations.|This molecular entity is different than ChEBI's 'molecular entity'.

Label: nucleic acid chain
Definition: A molecule that consists of nucleotides (unmodified nucleotide residues and/or modified nucleotide residues) linked by phosphodiester bonds or derivatives of such bonds.

Label: amino acid chain
Definition: An organic amino compound that consists of amino acid residues (unmodified amino-acid residues and/or modified amino-acid residues) linked by peptide bonds or derivatives of such bonds.

Label: protein
Definition: An amino acid chain that is produced de novo by ribosome-mediated translation of a genetically-encoded mRNA, and any derivatives thereof.

Label: sequence_feature
Definition: Any extent of continuous biological sequence.

Label: sequence_variant
Definition: A sequence_variant is a non exact copy of a sequence_feature or genome exhibiting one or more sequence_alteration.

Label: sequence_collection
Definition: A collection of discontinuous sequences.

Label: complex of molecules
Definition: A complex of two or more molecular entities that are not covalently bound.

Label: protein-containing complex
Definition: A stable assembly of two or more macromolecules, i.e. proteins, nucleic acids, carbohydrates or lipids, in which at least one component is a protein and the constituent parts function together.
Editor Note: This is not covalently bonded, which conflicts with changes to the parent definition.
COB Module Reason: member of 'cellular component' root group union

Label: virion component
Definition: Any constituent part of a virion, a complete fully infectious extracellular virus particle.
COB Module Reason: member of 'cellular component' root group union

Label: cellular anatomical entity
Definition: A part of a cellular organism that is either an immaterial entity or a material entity with granularity above the level of a protein complex but below that of an anatomical system. Or, a substance produced by a cellular organism with granularity above the level of a protein complex.
Editor Note: Overlaps with some cellular components from GO|Components are larger than individual macromolecular entities. It is tricky to define distinction between 'cell component' and 'macromolecular entity', e.g. ribosome. We would like to exclude most protein complexes.
COB Module Reason: member of 'cellular component' root group union

Label: cellular_component
Definition: A location, relative to cellular compartments and structures, occupied by a macromolecular machine. There are three types of cellular components described in the gene ontology: (1) the cellular anatomical entity where a gene product carries out a molecular function (e.g., plasma membrane, cytoskeleton) or membrane-enclosed compartments (e.g., mitochondrion); (2) virion components, where viral proteins act, and (3) the stable macromolecular complexes of which gene product are parts (e.g., the clathrin complex).
Equivalent Class Axiom: 'protein-containing complex' or 'virion component' or 'cellular anatomical entity'

Label: cell
Definition: A material entity of anatomical origin (part of or deriving from an organism) that has as its parts a maximally connected cell compartment surrounded by a plasma membrane.
Editor Note: We struggled with this definition. We are worried about circularity. We also considered requiring the capability of metabolism.|CL and GO definitions of cell differ based on inclusive or exclusive of cell wall, etc.

Label: plant cell
Definition: A cell which is a plant structure (PO:0009011).

Label: cell in vitro
Definition: A cell that is maintained or propagated in a controlled artificial environment for use in an investigation.

Label: gross anatomical part
Definition: A part of a multicellular organism that is a collection of cell components that are not all contained in one cell.
COB Module Reason: temporarily has a COB ID; waiting on Uberon's 'gross anatomical part' term

Label: material anatomical entity
Definition: Anatomical entity that has mass.
Equivalent Class Axiom: 'cellular anatomical entity' or 'cell' or 'gross anatomical part' or 'organism'

Label: plant anatomical entity
Definition: An anatomical entity that is or was part of a plant.

Label: organism
Definition: A material entity that is a maximal functionally integrated unit that develops from a program encoded in a genome
Editor Note: Includes virus - we will later have a class for cellular organisms.|'Maximal functionally integrated unit' is intended to express unity, which Barry considers synonymous with BFO 'object'.

Label: collection of organisms
Definition: A material entity that consists of two or more organisms, viruses, or viroids.

Label: geophysical entity
Definition: A material part of an astronomical body.

Label: ecosystem
Definition: An environmental system which includes both living and non-living components.

Label: Immaterial entities, such as cavities and anatomical spaces, can be individuated by their material boundaries. Material entities can be located in immaterial entities.
immaterial anatomical entity
Definition: Anatomical entity that has no mass.

Label: anatomical entity
Definition: Biological entity that is either an individual member of a biological species or constitutes the structural organization of an individual member of a biological species.

Label: has material boundary
Comment: like RO has 2D boundary? RO surrounded by?

Label: site
COB Module Reason: TO DISCUSS: in previous COB release

Label: Characteristics specifically depend on other entities. Characteristics of characteristics are not allowed.
Information entities generically depends on other entities. Information can be copied. Information is about some other thing.
information content entity
Definition: A generically dependent continuant that is about some thing.

Label: Processes ... have participants, have process parts
has information participant
Comment: by virtue of the material basis for that information

Label: physico-chemical process
Definition: A process in which at least one of the participants is a molecule.
Editor Note: This is meant to capture processes that are more fundamental than macromolecular activities

Label: gene product or complex activity
Definition: A molecular process that can be carried out by the action of a single macromolecular machine, usually via direct physical interactions with other molecular entities. Function in this sense denotes an action, or activity, that a gene product (or a complex) performs.
Editor Note: This is the same as GO molecular function
Comment: GO's 'molecular function'; this subClassOf axioms requires a 'gene product' term: 'enabled by' some ('gene product' or 'protein-containing complex')

Label: biological process
Definition: A biological process is the execution of a genetically-encoded biological module or program. It consists of all the steps required to achieve the specific biological objective of the module. A biological process is accomplished by a particular set of molecular functions carried out by specific gene products (or macromolecular complexes), often in a highly regulated manner and in a particular temporal sequence.
Subclass Axiom: 'has process part' some 'gene product or complex activity'

Label: exposure of organism
Definition: A process during which an organism comes into contact with another entity.

Label: environmental process
Definition: A process in which includes the components of an environmental system as participants.

Label: A realizable is a special characteristic that is realized by a processes; a role is a realizable that depends on a physical, social, or institutional context; a disposition does not depend on context; a function is a designed (intended) disposition
disposition
COB Module Reason: TO DISCUSS: in previous COB release

Label: function
COB Module Reason: TO DISCUSS: in previous COB release

Label: A plan specification is information about how a plan can be realized; a plan concretizes a plan specification; a plan is a characteristic of an agent; a completely executed planned process realizes a plan, and has specified inputs and outputs
plan
Definition: A plan is a realizable entity that is the inheres in a bearer who is committed to realizing it as a planned process.

Label: directive information entity
Definition: An information content entity whose concretizations indicate to their bearer how to realize them in a process.

Label: action specification
Definition: A directive information entity that describes an action the bearer will take.

Label: objective specification
Definition: A directive information entity that describes an intended process endpoint. When part of a plan specification the concretization is realized in a planned process in which the bearer tries to effect the world so that the process endpoint is achieved.

Label: plan specification
Definition: A directive information entity with action specifications and objective specifications as parts, and that may be concretized as a realizable entity that, if realized, is realized in a process in which the bearer tries to achieve the objectives by taking the actions specified.

Label: planned process
Definition: A process that is initiated by an agent who intends to carry out a plan to achieve an objective through one or more actions as described in a plan specification.

Label: A device is the output of a material processing, which is a completely executed planned process.
material processing
Definition: A planned process that intends to output material entities from input material entities
Subclass Axiom: 'has specified material input' some 'material entity' and 'has specified material output' some 'material entity'

Label: processed material entity
Definition: A material entity processed by human activity with an intent to produce it.
Editor Note: In the COB 2024 workshop there was much disagreement about this label.

Label: device
Definition: A processed material entity which is designed to be capable of a process.

Label: vaccine
Definition: Material entity that is manufactured to realize the vaccine function.

Label: drug product
Definition: a material entity (1) containing at least one scattered molecular aggregate as part that is the bearer of an active ingredient role and (2) that is itself the bearer of a clinical drug role

Label: food material
Definition: Any substance that can be consumed by an organism to satisfy nutritional or other health needs, or to provide a social or organoleptic food experience

Label: investigation
Definition: a planned process that consists of parts: planning, study design execution, documentation and which produce conclusion(s).

Label: assay
Definition: A planned process that has the objective to produce information about a material entity (the evaluant) by examining it.
Subclass Axiom: 'has specified material input' some 'material entity' and 'has specified information output' some 'data item'

Label: data item
Definition: An information content entity that is intended to be a truthful statement about something (modulo, e.g., measurement precision or other systematic errors) and is constructed/acquired by a method which reliably tends to produce (approximately) truthful statements.

Label: data transformation
Definition: A planned process that produces output data from input data.
Subclass Axiom: 'has specified information input' some 'data item' and 'has specified information output' some 'data item'

Label: specimen collection
Definition: A planned process with the objective of collecting a specimen.
Subclass Axiom: 'has specified material input' some 'material entity' and 'has specified material output' some 'specimen'

Label: specimen
Definition: A material entity that has the specimen role.

Label: specimen from organism
Definition: A specimen that derives from an anatomical part or substance arising from an organism. Examples of tissue specimen include tissue, organ, physiological system, blood, or body location (arm).

Definition: Number of protons in an atomic nucleus
